titleStmt.title: Despatch from Beverly Y. Payne to William F. Wharton, August 14, 1891

bibl.title: Despatch from Beverly Y. Payne to William F. Wharton
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.p:
Consulate General of the United States,
Monrovia, Liberia, August 14, 1891.

Mr Beverly Y. Payne,
To the Department of State.
Transmitting Accounts and returns of the Consular Agent at Elmina, for the quarter ended June 30 1891.

Consulate General of the United States,
Monrovia, Liberia, August 14, 1891.

Hon., William F. Wharton,
Assistant Secretary of State,
Washington, D.C.
I have the honor respectfully to transmit herewith the Accounts and returns of the Consular Agent at Elmina for the quarter ended June 30th 1891, as per subjoined list of enclosures.
I beg to state that the mail facilities prevented my transmitting them earlier.

I have the honor to be,
Sir:
Your obedient Servant,
Beverly Y. Payne,
U.S. Vice Consul General

1. Arrivals and Departures of Am. Vessels.
2. Summary of business.
3. Detailed Report of Official service to American vessels and seaman.
